trans-unit.source:
\n

Creates a stream whose backing store is memory.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxx x xxxxxx xxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxx xx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The array of unsigned bytes from which to create the current stream.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxx xx xxxxxxxx xxxxx xxxx xxxxx xx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The array of unsigned bytes from which to create this stream.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxx xx xxxxxxxx xxxxx xxxx xxxxx xx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The array of unsigned bytes from which to create this stream.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxx xx xxxxxxxx xxxxx xxxx xxxxx xx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The index into buffer at which the stream begins.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxx xxxx $xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ xx xxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The length of the stream in bytes.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The buffer length minus index is less than count.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xx xxxx xxxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The array of unsigned bytes from which to create this stream.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxx xx xxxxxxxx xxxxx xxxx xxxxx xx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The index in buffer at which the stream begins.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxx xx $xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ xx xxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The length of the stream in bytes.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The buffer length minus index is less than count.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xx xxxx xxxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The array of unsigned bytes from which to create this stream.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxx xx xxxxxxxx xxxxx xxxx xxxxx xx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The index into buffer at which the stream begins.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxx xxxx $xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ xx xxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The length of the stream in bytes.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The buffer length minus index is less than count.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xx xxxx xxxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The initial size of the internal array in bytes.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxx xx xxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets a value indicating whether the current stream supports reading.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx x xxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets a value indicating whether the current stream supports seeking.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx x xxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets a value indicating whether the current stream supports writing.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx x xxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source: true if the stream supports writing; otherwise, false.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxx$ xxxxxxxxx$ $xxxxxx$xxxxx$$xxxxxx$.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets or sets the number of bytes allocated for this stream.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The length of the usable portion of the buffer for the stream.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxx xxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A capacity is set that is negative or less than the current length of the stream.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxx xx xxxxxxxx xx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

\nset is invoked on a stream whose capacity cannot be modified.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xxxxxx$xxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxxxxxx xx x xxxxxx xxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the length of the stream in bytes.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The length of the stream in bytes.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets or sets the current position within the stream.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Asynchronously reads all the bytes from the current stream and writes them to another stream, using a specified buffer size and cancellation token.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxx xxx xxx xxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxx xx xxxxxxx xxxxxx$ xxxxx x xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The stream to which the contents of the current stream will be copied.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxx xx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The size, in bytes, of the buffer.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx$ xx xxxxx$ xx xxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
This value must be greater than zero.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxxx xxxxx xxxx xx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The token to monitor for cancellation requests.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxx xx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A task that represents the asynchronous copy operation.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Either the current stream or the destination stream is disposed.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The current stream does not support reading, or the destination stream does not support writing.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxx$ xx xxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx$ $xxxxxx$xxxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Asynchronously clears all buffers for this stream, and monitors cancellation requests.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxx$ xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The token to monitor for cancellation requests.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxx xx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A task that represents the asynchronous flush operation.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxx xxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Reads a block of bytes from the current stream and writes the data to a buffer.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxx x xxxxx xx xxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxx xxxx xx x xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

When this method returns, contains the specified byte array with the values between offset and (offset + count - 1) replaced by the characters read from the current stream.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxx$ xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxx $xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ xxx $$xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ $ $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ $ 0$ xxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin storing data from the current stream.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx$xxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xx $xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ xx xxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The maximum number of bytes to read.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xx xxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The total number of bytes written into the buffer.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that number of bytes are not currently available, or zero if the end of the stream is reached before any bytes are read.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxxx xxx xx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx$ xx xxxx xx xxx xxx xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxx xxx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

\noffset subtracted from the buffer length is less than count.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ xxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxx xxxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Asynchronously reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream, advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read, and monitors cancellation requests.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxx x xxxxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx$ xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxx$ xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The buffer to write the data into.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxx xxxx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The byte offset in buffer at which to begin writing data from the stream.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xxxxxx xx $xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ xx xxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The maximum number of bytes to read.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A task that represents the asynchronous read operation.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source: The value of the TResult parameter contains the total number of bytes read into the buffer.
trans-unit.target: Xxx xxxxx xx xxx $xx$XXxxxxx$$xx$ xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source: The result value can be less than the number of bytes requested if the number of bytes currently available is less than the requested number, or it can be 0 (zero) if the end of the stream has been reached.
trans-unit.target: Xxx xxxxxx xxxxx xxx xx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx$ xx xx xxx xx 0 $xxxx$ xx xxx xxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The sum of offset and count is larger than the buffer length.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxx xx $xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ xxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xx xxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The stream is currently in use by a previous read operation.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xx x xxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Reads a byte from the current stream.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxx x xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Sets the position within the current stream to the specified value.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source: This is relative to the loc parameter, and can be positive or negative.
trans-unit.target: Xxxx xx xxxxxxxx xx xxx $xx$xxx$$xx$ xxxxxxxxx$ xxx xxx xx xxxxxxxx xx xxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The new position within the stream, calculated by combining the initial reference point and the offset.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxx$ xxxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxx xxx xxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Seeking is attempted before the beginning of the stream.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Sets the length of the current stream to the specified value.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The value at which to set the length.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxx xx xxxxx xx xxx xxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
The current stream is not resizable and value is larger than the current capacity.

-or-

The current stream does not support writing.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xx xxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x$x$$xx$ $$x$$x$x$Xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Returns the array of unsigned bytes from which this stream was created.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxx xxx xxxxx xx xxxxxxxx xxxxx xxxx xxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
The return value indicates whether the conversion succeeded.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxx xxxxxx xxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The byte array segment from which this stream was created.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source: true if the conversion was successful; otherwise, false.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxx xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxx$ xxxxxxxxx$ $xxxxxx$xxxxx$$xxxxxx$.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Writes a block of bytes to the current stream using data read from a buffer.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxx x xxxxx xx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxx xxxx xxxx xxxx x xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin copying bytes to the current stream.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx$xxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xx $xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ xx xxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The maximum number of bytes to write.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xx xxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

\noffset subtracted from the buffer length is less than count.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ xxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxx xxxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Asynchronously writes a sequence of bytes to the current stream, advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written, and monitors cancellation requests.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx x xxxxxxxx xx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx$ xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxx$ xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The zero-based byte offset in buffer from which to begin copying bytes to the stream.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx$xxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xx $xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ xxxx xxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The maximum number of bytes to write.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A task that represents the asynchronous write operation.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxx xxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxx xxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The sum of offset and count is larger than the buffer length.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxx xx $xx$xxxxxx$$xx$ xxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xx xxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The stream is currently in use by a previous write operation.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xx x xxxxxxxx xxxxx xxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Writes a byte to the current stream at the current position.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxx x xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Writes the entire contents of this memory stream to another stream.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx xx xxxx xxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The stream to write this memory stream to.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xxxxxx xx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The current or target stream is closed.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxx xx xxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxx.
